title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 December 2012 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:37 <sdumitriu1> Denis: I'm here if you still need me  
00:38 <Denis> sdumitriu: thanks, that's ok, I reach my goal :)  
00:40 <Denis> we now have one farm migrated from 3.1 to 4.3.1 in production :)  
00:43 <Denis> sdumitriu: FYI, that was the one which has motivated all the work regarding duplicate IDs  
00:44 <Denis> more than one year from now, that was a very long time for a fix !  
00:45 <sdumitriu1> Congrats!  
00:45 <Denis> and it is done before the end of the world :D  
00:45 <sdumitriu1> Well, backwards compatibility is never something that actually makes things faster  
00:46 <sdumitriu1> Will you have time to work on changset IDs? (I guess Vincent told you about the problem with changeset hashes, right?)  
00:47 <Denis> no, he don't, what is the issue ?  
00:47 <sdumitriu1> brb  
00:47 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:49 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <Denis> are you talking about liquibase hashes ?  
00:49 <sdumitriu1> Yes  
00:50 <Denis> oh, we talk about that, but there is no real issue afaik  
00:50 <Denis> what mostly happen is that users does not properly restore their DBs  
00:52 <Denis> I have added some clearer warning regarding the stats migration issue for user having a database that was populated with a version older than 2.2  
00:53 <Denis> I also wondering if we should add a warning to remind user to do a backup before migration, and I also propose to add some word about the tables created by liquibase in the change logs  
00:54 <Denis> Vincent suggest to create a FAQ about migration, but this is not an easy job IMO  
01:06 <polx> has quit  
01:07 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
01:07 <Denis> sdumitriu: if you have scenario that cause wrong failure due to these hashes, there exists a possibility to ignore than in liquibase, but it may be more risky that keeping the check  
01:08 <polx> has quit  
01:08 <Denis> s/than/them/  
01:08 <Denis> s/that/than/  
01:08 <Denis> I should go to bed :)  
01:12 <Denis> sdumitriu: added some explanations, feel free to improve :)

09:58 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <tmortagne> anyone knows where the temporary directory is when using jetty/hsqldb distribution ?  
10:06 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
10:48 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think the system tmp, let me find the reference again  
11:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes it's /tmp  
11:01 <vmassol> http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/Temporary+Directories  
11:11 <polx> has quit  
11:13 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <GuillaumeF> Hello there. On jira.xwiki.org, I don't find any project for reporting about Distribution Wizard. Any clue?  
11:55 <tmortagne> GuillaumeF: it's Extension Manager  
11:55 <GuillaumeF> I thought it was two different things  
11:55 <GuillaumeF> thanks  
11:55 <tmortagne> not yet  
11:56 <tmortagne> and what you are going to report has probably a lot more to do with EM that DW  
11:56 <tmortagne> s/that/than/  
11:57 <GuillaumeF> no, it's about DW usability :-)  
11:57 <GuillaumeF> ease of use if you want  
11:58 <sburjan`> GuillaumeF: I reported the one about XEM conflicts  
11:58 <vmassol> it's EM GuillaumeF  
11:58 <vmassol> there's the same problem in the EM UI  
11:58 <vmassol> and DW reuses EM UI  
11:59 <vmassol> (for your UC)  
11:59 <vmassol> (which I happen to know of ;))  
11:59 <GuillaumeF> I see, but I want to report about the fact that you can be blocked for hours, without seeing that a document is in conflict, when you are is hided details mode  
11:59 <GuillaumeF> ok ok  
12:00 <vmassol> ah there are 2 issues  
12:00 <GuillaumeF> For developers and people that knows how works DW, it's ok, but for an user that don't usually clicks on "Show Details", it's not that simple  
12:00 <vmassol> one is about the closing logs  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea was supposed to have fixed it but it's still there  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: when you log in, and you come back to the DW screen the "show details" logs is closed and the user needs to click to open it again  
12:01 <vmassol> the other is about merge conflcit not visible at the bottom of logs  
12:01 <GuillaumeF> you mean that you have to scroll down, right?  
12:01 <vmassol> yes  
12:01 <mflorea> GuillaumeF: which version?  
12:01 <GuillaumeF> 4.3.1  
12:02 <GuillaumeF> I can report both of them if you want  
12:02 <mflorea> vmassol: when you come back the details are expanded  
12:02 <vmassol> are you sure?  
12:02 <mflorea> well, I fixed it  
12:02 <GuillaumeF> I can try again to be sure  
12:03 <vmassol> mflorea: it seems GuillaumeF had to click  
12:03 <vmassol> he's on 4.3.1  
12:03 <vmassol> and I also remember this (but not 100% sure on my side)  
12:03 <GuillaumeF> let me try again, maybe I hide it by myself without paying too much attention  
12:04 <mflorea> GuillaumeF: I don't know you did exactly, wdym by "hidden details mode"?  
12:04 <mflorea> if you collapsed the details yourself then it's normal  
12:04 <sburjan`> that the "Show Details" section is not expanded  
12:04 <vmassol> sburjan`: can you confirm that it was the case for you too?  
12:06 <GuillaumeF> The only thing that I'm sure, is that if you're in the hidden details mode (details section not expanded), whatever I clicked on "hide details" or not, the section won't be expanded  when the conflict occurs.  
12:08 <GuillaumeF> Let me confirm everything I said :-)  
12:08 <GuillaumeF> (or refute)  
12:09 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <mflorea> GuillaumeF: the EM shows you the progress tab (and thus the conflict) when the page is loaded, if there is progress or a conflict. Now, if after the page is loaded, and during the install, you switch to a different tab (say dependencies or description) or if you click on Hide Details, the EM won't show you the conflict because you \_choose\_ to hide the details or to look at a different tab  
12:12 <sburjan`> I get BY DEFAULT (without doing antything) that section EXPANDED. After the modal and Admin login, I still have that expanded. What is hard to see there is the merge. You have to scroll down to see the merge issue. Because if you don't scroll down, yuou'll keep looking at the progress bar and wonder why it's stuck  
12:12 <sburjan`> (at least on my resolution, I am connected via RDP)  
12:15 <GuillaumeF> IMO, whenever a conflict appears, the section should expand automatically, even if the person clicked on Hide  
12:17 <GuillaumeF> either directly in progress tab, or showing there is a conflict by another mean. Idk  
12:17 <vmassol> I agree, you could create an improvement request for this  
12:18 <vmassol> I had the same issue as you, waiting for DW/EM to finish and not knowing there was a conflcit and I had to click somewhere  
12:18 <vmassol> I tihink we've all had it  
12:18 <vmassol> (except maybe marius/thomas ;))  
12:18 <tmortagne> that's because DW don't like you  
12:19 <vmassol> :)  
12:19 <vmassol> I like it  
12:20 <GuillaumeF> BTW, DW is a very great improvement. I know that you're working on it for a long time, but I only used it a couple of time, and I'm curious to see how it will be better to upgrade wikis with the help of it.  
12:20 <GuillaumeF> (I can't come here and only complaining :p )  
12:21 <mflorea> guys, I agree about scrolling down to the conflict \_if\_ you are on the progress tab, but otherwise, if you chosen to look at a different tab or to hide the details then this is you choice.  
12:22 <GuillaumeF> So at least a non intrusive message could remind that a conflict has been detected  
12:23 <vmassol> mflorea: as GuillaumeF said what's important is that you know there's a conflict  
12:23 <mflorea> I'm fine with this, and I talked with Caty about doing some CSS trick to "highlight" the progress tab when there is a conflict and you are on a differnt tab  
12:23 <vmassol> whatever the mean  
12:23 <vmassol> it could be some read flashing thing  
12:23 <vmassol> \*red  
12:24 <vmassol> or a modal dialog box popping up with "conflict found, with the detail and the choice to make"  
12:24 <vmassol> s/"//  
12:24 <vmassol> or anyting else  
12:24 <vmassol> provided the user knows there's a conflict and is told what to do  
12:25 <GuillaumeF> Unless you want to show something like that ( http://www.omfgdogs.com/ ) I'm ok with any warning  
14:30 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
14:31 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
14:50 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: hi  
15:20 <vmassol> is this an important bug fix? is it dangerous? I'm asking because 4.4 is a stabilization release and we're not allowed to put anything risky in it  
15:22 <vmassol> looks like a pretty large commit  
15:22 <vmassol> thus risky and dangerous  
15:24 <AndreasJonsson> It is the work in feature-authorization-context.  It is definitely an important bug fix, but also risky.  
15:24 <vmassol> we're very close to 4.4RC1 now  
15:25 <vmassol> so I'm a bit worried by the commit that nobody else aprart from you has any knowledge about  
15:25 <vmassol> it's also christmas time and I don't know if committers/you will be around to fix any issue that may arise before the release of Thursday  
15:26 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: I really think this should be pushed to 5.0  
15:27 <vmassol> 4.4 and 4.5 are stailization releases only  
15:27 <vmassol> this looks like too large a change for 4.4/4.5  
15:27 <vmassol> 4.5 is supposed to be released at end of january  
15:28 <tmortagne> AndreasJonsson: should this commit be only in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/feature-authorization-context branch ?  
15:28 <AndreasJonsson> I squashed it into one commit.  
15:28 <vmassol> what do others think? am I wrong to worry?  
15:28 <tmortagne> so the ci log is a merge of all your commits ?  
15:29 <tmortagne> I agree with vmassol that it's not a minor change that you merged and it's probably a bit short for 4.4  
15:29 <AndreasJonsson> There were some changes back and forth in the branch, so I thought it would be better to squash it for easier code review.  
15:29 <tmortagne> sure it's not really the issue :)  
15:30 <tmortagne> just talking about introducing big changes that late in 4.4 branch  
15:30 <tmortagne> since 4.4/4.5 are mostly big RCs for 4.x branch  
15:31 <tmortagne> maybe this should wait 5.0, WDYT ?  
15:31 <vmassol> at the very minimum it requires a vote to merge now on master  
15:32 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: if you really think it should go in the 4.x cycle I'd suggest you send a vote. I'll personally vote ?1 though unless you can convince me it's really needed and not dangerous :)  
15:32 <vmassol> (really needed for 4.x that is)  
15:35 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: Ok.  I'll wait for jenkins to complete the functional tests.  If there are too many regressions, maybe I'll revert it without a vote ;).  
15:37 <vmassol> actually I really think you should revert  
15:37 <vmassol> now  
15:37 <vmassol> we're also trying to stabilize the build ATM  
15:37 <vmassol> so sending a  lot of emails from jenkis is not going to help us at this time :)  
15:37 <vmassol> it's going to push us back by half a day  
15:37 <vmassol> (the time to restabilize the whole build - it's so slow…. :()  
15:38 <tmortagne> IMO this is really something that should be committed at the very beginning of a new major version to have plenty of time to find all the weird side effects  
15:38 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: don't misunderstand me, it's great that you work on this but it's really dangerous for 4.x and nobody else other than you know this code and can supprot it  
15:38 <tmortagne> and given the subject there will be  
15:39 <vmassol> your VOTE email has also not received much answer  
15:45 <AndreasJonsson> I understand that you are worried, I was kind of expecting that.  I have been running this code myself live on 4.3 and I thought that the problems with the panels was because of my code (but it turned out to be unrelated) and unfortunately I did not have time to debug it at the beginning of the 4.4 cycle.  
15:46 <vmassol> we need to be able to tell people to use 4.4 and 4.5 safely with no risk and benefit from all the work done in 4.x  
15:47 <vmassol> it really makes sense to move this to 5.x IMO, you can still build that branch and use it for your own project in the meantime. 5.0 dev is going to start in not long (1 month)  
15:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: something I don't understand. I have built XE 4.4 SNAP jetty/hsqldb and removed the data/ dir. I have configured hib.cfg.xml to point to an empty oracle DB and when I start XE I don't get the DW. What am I missing?  
15:53 <vmassol> in the log I have: 2012-12-21 15:51:50,666 [main] INFO  istributionInitializerListener - Distribution state: NEW  
15:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: well you should have it if the state is NEW  
15:54 <vmassol> I'm not logged in but that's normal for an empty DB  
15:54 <tmortagne> yes  
15:54 <vmassol> some regression?  
15:55 <vmassol> do we have any test for this?  
15:55 <tmortagne> it's possible, I just committed something on this  
15:55 <vmassol> (func test I mean)  
15:55 <tmortagne> we don't have any test with empty database no  
15:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: what happen when you go to http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/distribution/XWiki/Distribution ?  
15:57 <vmassol> I get directed to http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome;jsessionid=pzprjzwhtxca1gf42ina9sq8m  
15:57 <tmortagne> ok, checking something  
16:02 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: your VOTE did not pass  
16:02 <vmassol> you cannot commit without a successful vote  
16:02 <vmassol> a passed VOTE is 3 +1 minimum, see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Committership  
16:03 <vmassol> marius even gave a ?0  
16:07 <sburjan`> has quit  
16:17 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol:  I'm not sure which vote you are refering to.  I have not proposed any vote regarding this yet.  
16:19 <vmassol> ok maybe I confued with a mail you sent entitled "[Security] Feature-authorization-context ready for merge"  
16:19 <vmassol> so it's even worse :)  
16:19 <vmassol> this kind of thing really requires a vote  
16:19 <vmassol> in any case if you don't vote you need to expect people to ask you to revert  
16:19 <vmassol> that's part of our defined rules  
16:19 <vmassol> and it's ok  
16:20 <vmassol> (see  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Committership )  
16:20 <vmassol> "In general votes should be sent in case of big changes (whether it's about code or about processes or people). A vote is mandatory for voting in new committers or from removing committers. It's not necessary to send a vote when performing minor or even sometimes substantial modifications provided the author judges everyone would agree to them. This is called lazy consensus. However should someone objects to the code committed, the autho  
16:22 <polx> has quit  
16:23 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: tell me if you can reproduce the DW issue at startup  
16:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: I fixed one thing but there is something else  
16:25 <tmortagne> it looks like guest does not have admin right right anymore  
16:25 <tmortagne> recleaning to be sure  
16:27 <vmassol> ok  
16:27 <tmortagne> you can test on your side too with my last commit, maybe I have an issue in my setup  
16:28 <tmortagne> would not be the first timme  
16:28 <vmassol> another issue, I've tried doing a xar import of ui-all and I get errors in the console: https://gist.github.com/raw/4353463/45f6f6afe8b340e606f23d32c1845ceed4d64080/gistfile1.txt  
16:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: Denis reported it today too  
16:29 <vmassol> ok  
16:29 <vmassol> it looks like a blocker to me for 4.4RC1  
16:30 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8630  
16:30 <tmortagne> well worst that 4.4RC1 actually  
16:30 <tmortagne> Denis reported it on 4.3.1  
16:30 <vmassol> ouch  
16:30 <vmassol> marking blocker  
16:30 <vmassol> and setting fix for  
16:31 <tmortagne> to be debugged but I guess the Admin user or XWikiPreferences  is imported after the various ui extensions  
16:31 <vmassol> ATM I'm on the oracle issue , trying to reproduce it  
16:31 <tmortagne> it's not visible with DW since admin app is imported first  
16:31 <vmassol> hmm sorin is on holidays I think, too bad, can't reproduce his oracle problme  
16:32 <vmassol> at least not with XAR import  
16:32 <vmassol> need your fix to be able to retest with DW  
16:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: I committed my fix as I said  
16:32 <tmortagne> the issue with guest right is something else  
16:32 <tmortagne> and probably only on my side  
16:32 <vmassol> ok  
16:33 <tmortagne> unless it's caused by Andres commit  
16:34 <vmassol> I need to be careful because there's no AndreasJonsson commit which will prevent me from building  
16:34 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: I'm going to revert your commit  
16:34 <vmassol> I would have preferred that you do it  
16:35 <mrvanes> has quit  
16:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're talking about https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b3613c92e0246365f769e391572deffda39a1605 ?  
16:40 <tmortagne> yes  
16:40 <vmassol> I didn't relaize it was related to my issue because it talks about downgrading  
16:40 <tmortagne> the title is related to what I fixed previously  
16:40 <vmassol> ah I see  
16:40 <tmortagne> and for which I introduced a regression  
16:41 <tmortagne> inverted a if as usual...  
16:41 <vmassol> not easy for me to restest but doing it, need to clean manually my oracle db  
16:41 <tmortagne> not really  
16:41 <tmortagne> not to check if you get the DW at  least  
16:42 <tmortagne> but for your real test I don't know  
16:46 <vmassol> ok I get the DW  
16:46 <tmortagne> ok cool  
16:47 <vmassol> but it means we have no test about it, we need to think about adding one I think since it's an important feature  
16:51 <cjd> woot, can edit wiki tables using jquery.sheet :D  
16:52 <cjd> over each wiki table is a edit button and when you click it you get a lightbox with a spreadsheet reflecting that table  
16:52 <cjd> now to make it work on anything other than chromium  
16:52 <vmassol> nice, eager to see your extension on e.x.o and try it ;)  
16:53 <vmassol> mflorea: I can confirm that after logging in the show details button is there and details are NOT expanded  
16:54 <vmassol> but maybe that's because it worke without error  
16:54 <vmassol> ?  
16:54 <vmassol> when I clicked show details it even went to Description and not Progress  
17:15 <evalica> has quit  
17:20 <mflorea> vmassol: if there is no reason to show the details or the progress tab is the job (=install) was done  
17:20 <mflorea> s/is/or  
17:21 <mflorea> s/is/if  
17:21 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:22 <vmassol> ok
